X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=215482878

> Rev Tamas wrote:
>
>> Thanks!
>> So I need to use not the API but the command-line interface.
>
> I'd suggest following Yan's suggestion and get the command line
> interface working first.  Once thats working against your ARCs and its
> not throwing 'Failed to find GZIP MAGIC' complaints, then move to using
> the ARCReader API. Study how the ARCReader#main works for example usage
> of the ARCReader API (Pass the '--help' to see ARCReader options).
>
> The 'Failed to find GZIP MAGIC' message means ARCReader is failing to
> parse the ARC: Its trying to find the next gzip member in what it thinks
> a gzipped stream and is unable to find the MAGIC number that introduces
> the gzip header.  Test your ARCs with 'gzip -t' to see that they are
> wholesome gzip files before giving them to ARCReader.
>
> St.Ack
Okay, now the command line interface is working. If I set a proper offset,
there will be no GZIP MAGIC complaint :) Now I can go on using arcreader.

thx:
bridge
